docs.lead_paragraph: Everybody loves dolphins, those playful models of animal wisdom, celebrated for protecting shipwrecked sailors and spending their days frolicking happily in the waves. Movies, television and water shows feature their antics. Nowadays, thousands of tourists swim with dolphins, captive and wild, with more signing up every day to commune with their animal intelligence. Most recently, a variety of organizations have sprung up that offer tours to places like the Florida Keys, the Azores and New Zealand, where participants can swim with wild dolphins and, brochures proclaim, experience emotional healing and spiritual awakening.

headline.main: Evidence Puts Dolphins In New Light, As Killers

docs.abstract: Common human view of dolphins as friendly, playful and wise is called into question by evidence that they kill other mammals in droves, using beaks as clubs and slashing away with rows of sharp teeth; scientists report dolphins have bludgeoned porpoises and even kill their own young, moved by murderous urges unrelated to need for food; report biting and bumping of human swimmers; debunk several flattering myths about these 'big, wild animals'; some myths about dolphins debunked; photos (M)
